fields.name: action
fields.comment: The action performed on the resource.

fields.name: app
fields.comment: The application involved in the event (such as ssh, splunk, win:local).

fields.name: authentication_method
fields.comment: The method used to authenticate the request

fields.name: authentication_service
fields.comment: The service used to authenticate the request

fields.name: dest
fields.comment: The target involved in the authentication. You can alias this from more specific fields, such as dest_host, dest_ip, or dest_nt_host.

fields.name: src_user_type
fields.comment: The type of the user who initiated the privilege escalation.

fields.name: user_type
fields.comment:
The type of the user involved in the event or who initiated the event.
IAMUser, Admin, or System.

fields.name: src_user_role
fields.comment: The role of the user who initiated the privilege escalation.

fields.name: user_role
fields.comment: The role of the user involved in the event, or who initiated the event. For authentication privilege escalation events, this should represent the user role targeted by the escalation.

fields.name: user_agent
fields.comment: The user agent through which the request was made, such as Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_14_6) or aws-cli/2.0.0 Python/3.7.4 Darwin/18.7.0 botocore/2.0.0dev4.

fields.name: duration
fields.validity: if(isnum(duration) and duration>0 and duration<3600, duration, null())
fields.comment: The amount of time for the completion of the authentication event, in seconds.

fields.name: response_time
fields.comment: The amount of time it took to receive a response in the authentication event, in seconds.

fields.name: signature
fields.comment: A human-readable signature name.

fields.name: signature_id
fields.comment: The unique identifier or event code of the event signature.

fields.name: src
fields.comment: The name of the user involved in the event, or who initiated the event. For authentication privilege escalation events, this should represent the user targeted by the escalation.

fields.name: user
fields.comment: The name of the user involved in the event, or who initiated the event. For authentication privilege escalation events, this should represent the user targeted by the escalation.

fields.name: user_id
fields.comment: The unique id of the user involved in the event.

fields.name: reason
fields.comment: The human-readable message associated with the authentication action (success or failure).

fields.name: src_user
fields.comment: In privilege escalation events, src_user represents the user who initiated the privilege escalation. This field is unnecessary when an escalation has not been performed. If present it must be a valid user.

fields.name: vendor_account
fields.comment: The account that manages the user that initiated the request. The account represents the organization, a Cloud customer, or a Cloud account.
